content.name: alias
content.description: Create a shortcut for a command, so you can run long commands with a short alias.

example.output: ll will now list files in long format including hidden files

options.description: Removes a previously defined alias. Example: unalias ll removes the 'll' shortcut.

content.name: arch
content.description: Shows system hardware architecture, for example whether it is 32-bit or 64-bit.

content.name: at
content.description: Schedule ad-hoc commands to run at a specific time.

options.description: Read commands to run from a file instead of standard input. Example: at -f myscript.sh 15:30
Send mail notification when the job finishes.

content.name: awk
content.description: A powerful text processing language used to scan patterns and manipulate data in files.

options.description: Set a custom field separator. Example: awk -F':' '{print $1}' file.txt splits columns using ':'
Assign a variable for use inside awk. Example: awk -v threshold=10 '{if($2>threshold) print $0}' file.txt
Read an awk program from a file instead of writing inline. Example: awk -f script.awk file.txt

content.name: apt
content.description: Ubuntu's package manager, used to install, remove, and update software packages.

example.output:
Hit:1 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal InRelease
Reading package lists... Done

Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree...
The following NEW packages will be installed: htop

options.description: Installs a package. Example: sudo apt install htop
Removes a package. Example: sudo apt remove htop
Upgrades all installed packages. Example: sudo apt upgrade

content.name: basename
content.description: Extract the filename from a full path, optionally removing a suffix.

options.description: Remove the specified suffix from the filename. Example: basename file.txt .txt returns 'file'.

content.name: bc
content.description: Basic command-line calculator, supports integer and floating-point math.

options.description: Use the math library for floating point operations and functions. Example: echo 's(1)' | bc -l

content.name: bg
content.description: Resume a suspended job in the background.

content.name: break
content.description: Exit from a loop prematurely in shell scripts.

example.command: for i in 1 2 3; do if [ $i -eq 2 ]; then break; fi; echo $i; done

content.name: builtin
content.description: Run a shell builtin command, bypassing functions or external commands with the same name.

content.name: cal
content.description: Displays a calendar in the terminal.

example.output:
January 2026
Su Mo Tu We Th Fr Sa
             1  2  3
...

options.description: No specific options required for basic usage.

content.name: case
content.description: Used in shell scripts for conditional branching based on patterns.

example.command: case $var in 1) echo One;; 2) echo Two;; esac

content.name: cat
content.description: Concatenate and display files.

options.description: Number all output lines. Example: cat -n file.txt
Number non-blank lines only. Example: cat -b file.txt

content.name: cd
content.description: Change the current working directory.

content.name: chage
content.description: Change user password expiry information.

options.description: List the password aging info for a user.

content.name: chgrp
content.description: Change the group ownership of files or directories.

options.description: Apply changes recursively to all files and directories.

content.name: chmod
content.description: Change file or directory permissions.

example.output: Sets read/write/execute for owner, read/execute for group and others

content.name: chown
content.description: Change the owner and/or group of a file or directory.

example.output: Changes owner to 'user' and group to 'staff'

options.description: Apply ownership changes recursively to directories.

content.name: chronyc
content.description: Client tool for controlling and monitoring NTP daemon chronyd.

example.output: Shows current time tracking stats from chronyd

content.name: clear
content.description: Clears the terminal screen.

content.name: cmp
content.description: Compare two files byte by byte.

example.output: No output if files are identical; otherwise shows first differing byte

options.description: Print the byte numbers and differing bytes for all differences.

content.name: command
content.description: Run a command, ignoring shell functions and builtins of the same name.

options.description: Show help information for a command.

content.name: cp
content.description: Copy files and directories.

content.name: createrepo
content.description: Create a YUM repository from a directory of RPM packages.

example.output: Generates metadata for the RPM repository

content.name: crontab
content.description: Schedule recurring tasks using cron.

options.description: List all cron jobs for the current user.
Edit the crontab for the current user.

content.name: curl
content.description: Transfer data to or from a server using URL syntax.

options.description: Save the remote file with the same name locally.

content.name: cut
content.description: Extract sections from each line of a file or input.

example.output: Prints the first column of file.csv separated by commas

options.description: Select fields. Example: -f1 selects the first column

content.name: date
content.description: Display or set the system date and time.

options.description: Customize the output format. Example: date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'
Set the system date. Example: sudo date -s '2026-01-13 12:00:00'

content.name: dd
content.description: Convert and copy files at a low level, often used for creating disk images.

options.description: Input file or device. Example: if=/dev/sda
Output file or device. Example: of=/backup/sda.img

content.name: df
content.description: Display disk space usage of filesystems.

example.output:
Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/sda1       50G   20G   28G  42% /

content.name: diff
content.description: Compare files line by line and show differences.

example.output: Shows line differences between file1.txt and file2.txt

options.description: Show unified format differences. Useful for patches.

content.name: dig
content.description: DNS lookup utility.

options.description: Query a specific DNS server. Example: dig @8.8.8.8 example.com

content.name: dmesg
content.description: Display kernel ring buffer messages, useful for debugging hardware issues.

example.output: Shows the last few kernel messages

content.name: dmidecode
content.description: Dump computer’s BIOS and hardware information.

example.output: Displays system BIOS, memory, and hardware information

options.description: Show only entries of a given type. Example: sudo dmidecode -t memory

content.name: do
content.description: Used in shell scripts as part of loop syntax (for/while/until).

example.command: for i in 1 2 3; do echo $i; done

content.name: du
content.description: Estimate file and directory space usage.

example.output: Prints size of each folder/file in human-readable format

options.description: Display only total size of each argument.

content.name: echo
content.description: Display a line of text or variables to the standard output.

options.description: Do not output the trailing newline. Example: echo -n Hello
Enable interpretation of backslash escapes. Example: echo -e "Hello\nWorld"

content.name: else
content.description: Used in shell scripts as part of an if-else conditional statement.

example.command: if [ $x -eq 1 ]; then echo Yes; else echo No; fi

content.name: ethtool
content.description: Display or change Ethernet device settings.

example.output: Shows the status and capabilities of interface eth0

options.description: Show driver information. Example: ethtool -i eth0
Change settings like speed or duplex. Example: sudo ethtool -s eth0 speed 100 duplex full

content.name: exit
content.description: Exit from the current shell or script.

example.output: Exits the shell with status code 0

options.description: Can be followed by an optional numeric status code. Default is 0.

content.name: export
content.description: Set environment variables for the current session or child processes.

example.output: Adds /usr/local/bin to the PATH variable for the session

content.name: env
content.description: Display or run a command in a modified environment.

options.description: Start with an empty environment. Example: env -i bash

content.name: eval
content.description: Execute arguments as a shell command.

content.name: fdisk
content.description: Partition table manipulator for Linux disks.

example.output: Lists all partitions on all disks

options.description: List partition tables for all devices.
Specify a particular device to manipulate. Example: sudo fdisk /dev/sda

content.name: fg
content.description: Bring a background job to the foreground in the shell.

example.output: Brings job number 1 to the foreground

content.name: fi
content.description: Used in shell scripts to close an if statement.

content.name: find
content.description: Search for files and directories in a directory hierarchy.

example.output: Lists all .txt files in /home/user and subdirectories

options.description: Search by filename pattern. Example: find / -name 'file.txt'
Search by file type (f=file, d=directory). Example: find /home -type d
Execute a command on each found file. Example: find . -name '*.log' -exec rm {} \;

content.name: firewall-cmd
content.description: Command-line tool for managing firewalld.

options.description: Specify the zone to operate on. Example: sudo firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-all
Add a service to a zone. Example: sudo firewall-cmd --add-service=http

content.name: firewall-config
content.description: GUI tool for configuring firewalld.

content.name: for
content.description: Used in shell scripts to create loops.

example.command: for i in 1 2 3; do echo $i; done

content.name: free
content.description: Display memory usage statistics.

example.output: Shows memory and swap usage in human-readable format

content.name: fsck
content.description: Filesystem consistency check and repair.

options.description: Do not make changes; just report.

content.name: ftp
content.description: File Transfer Protocol client for transferring files.

example.output: Connects to ftp.example.com for file transfer

options.description: Enable verbose mode to see all server responses.

content.name: grep
content.description: Search for patterns in files using regular expressions.

options.description: Invert match (show lines that do NOT match). Example: grep -v 'pass' file.txt

content.name: groupadd
content.description: Create a new user group.

options.description: Specify group ID. Example: sudo groupadd -g 1001 developers

content.name: groupdel
content.description: Delete a user group.

content.name: gunzip
content.description: Decompress .gz files.

options.description: Decompress to stdout. Example: gunzip -c file.gz > file.txt

content.name: gzip
content.description: Compress files to .gz format.

options.description: Decompress a file. Example: gzip -d file.txt.gz
Write output to stdout. Example: gzip -c file.txt > file.txt.gz

content.name: halt
content.description: Shut down the system immediately.

example.output: The system will stop all processes and power off.

options.description: Force halt without contacting the init system.

content.name: head
content.description: Display the first few lines of a file.

example.output: Displays the first 5 lines of file.txt

options.description: Show the first N lines. Example: head -n 10 file.txt
Show the first N bytes. Example: head -c 20 file.txt

content.name: history
content.description: Show command history in the shell.

example.output: Displays previously executed commands in the current shell session

options.description: Write history to the history file immediately.

content.name: hostname
content.description: Display or set the system’s hostname.

example.output: Sets the hostname to 'myserver' temporarily until reboot

content.name: hostnamectl
content.description: Query and change the system hostname and related settings.

example.output: Displays detailed hostname info including static, transient, and pretty hostname

options.description: Show the current hostname and related info

content.name: id
content.description: Display user and group information for the current user or a specified user.

options.description: Display only the user ID. Example: id -u
Display only the primary group ID. Example: id -g
Display all group IDs. Example: id -G

content.name: if
content.description: Shell keyword used to create conditional statements.

content.name: ifconfig
content.description: Display or configure network interfaces (deprecated in favor of 'ip').

example.output: Shows information about all active network interfaces

options.description: Specify the network interface. Example: ifconfig eth0
Bring an interface up. Example: ifconfig eth0 up
Bring an interface down. Example: ifconfig eth0 down

content.name: init
content.description: The parent of all processes; used to change runlevels or system targets.

example.output: Switches the system to runlevel 3 (multi-user mode without GUI)

options.description: Change runlevel to N. Example: init 0 shuts down, init 6 reboots.

content.name: iostat
content.description: Display CPU and I/O statistics for devices and partitions.

example.output: Shows CPU usage and I/O stats for all disks

options.description: Display stats in kilobytes per second.

content.name: ip
content.description: Show or manipulate routing, devices, policy routing, and tunnels.

example.output: Displays all network interfaces and IP addresses

content.name: iptables
content.description: Configure the Linux kernel firewall.

options.description: Append a rule to a chain.
Delete a rule from a chain.

content.name: id
content.description: Display user and group information.

content.name: if
content.description: Shell keyword for conditional statements.

content.name: ifconfig
content.description: Display or configure network interfaces (deprecated in favor of ip).

content.name: init
content.description: Change runlevels or system targets.

options.description: Set runlevel N. E.g., init 0 shuts down.

content.name: iostat
content.description: Display CPU and I/O statistics.

content.name: ip
content.description: Manage IP addresses, routes, and interfaces.

content.name: iptables
content.description: Linux firewall management.

content.name: jobs
content.description: List current shell jobs.

content.name: kill
content.description: Terminate a process by PID or name.

content.name: killall
content.description: Kill processes by name.

content.name: last
content.description: Show last logins.

content.name: less
content.description: View file contents one page at a time.

content.name: ln
content.description: Create links between files.

example.output: Creates a symbolic link file2.txt pointing to file1.txt

content.name: locale
content.description: Display locale settings.

content.name: ls
content.description: List directory contents.

example.output: Lists all files in long format

content.name: lvcreate
content.description: Create a logical volume.

example.output: Creates 10G logical volume lv_data in vg0

content.name: lvdisplay
content.description: Display logical volume info.

content.name: mail
content.description: Send or read emails from the command line.

content.name: mailx
content.description: Improved mail client (like mail).

content.name: man
content.description: Display the manual of a command.

content.name: mkdir
content.description: Create directories.

content.name: mkfs.xfs
content.description: Create XFS filesystem on a partition.

content.name: mkswap
content.description: Set up a swap area on a device or file.

content.name: modprobe
content.description: Load or remove kernel modules.

content.name: more
content.description: View file content page by page.

content.name: mount
content.description: Mount a filesystem.

content.name: mv
content.description: Move or rename files/directories.

content.name: netstat
content.description: Display network connections, routing tables, interface stats.

example.output: Shows active TCP/UDP connections with PIDs

content.name: nice
content.description: Run a command with a modified scheduling priority.

content.name: nohup
content.description: Run a command immune to hangups.

example.output: Runs long_task.sh in background even if terminal closes

content.name: nslookup
content.description: Query DNS to obtain domain name or IP address.

content.name: ntpq
content.description: Query NTP server status and statistics.

content.name: openssl
content.description: Tool for SSL/TLS related operations.

content.name: passwd
content.description: Change user password.

content.name: ping
content.description: Send ICMP echo requests to a host to test connectivity.

content.name: pkill
content.description: Kill processes by name.

content.name: pvcreate
content.description: Initialize a physical volume for LVM.

content.name: pvdisplay
content.description: Display information about physical volumes.

content.name: pvs
content.description: List physical volumes in LVM.

example.output: Displays all PVs with size and VG

content.name: pwd
content.description: Print current working directory.

content.name: quota
content.description: Display disk usage and limits for users.

example.output: Shows disk usage and limits for 'user'

options.description: Show quota for a specific user

content.name: reboot
content.description: Reboot the system.

content.name: rm
content.description: Remove files or directories.

content.name: rmdir
content.description: Remove empty directories.

content.name: rpm
content.description: RPM package manager for Red Hat-based systems.

content.name: rsync
content.description: Remote and local file synchronization tool.

content.name: scp
content.description: Securely copy files between hosts.

content.name: sed
content.description: Stream editor for text processing.

content.name: shutdown
content.description: Shutdown or halt the system.

content.name: sort
content.description: Sort lines of text files.

content.name: ssh
content.description: Secure shell to connect to remote machines.

content.name: stat
content.description: Display file or filesystem status.

example.output: Shows file info like size, permissions, timestamps

content.name: su
content.description: Switch user or become superuser.

content.name: sudo
content.description: Execute command as another user, typically root.

content.name: swapon
content.description: Enable swap space.

content.name: swapoff
content.description: Disable swap space.

content.name: systemctl
content.description: Control systemd services and units.

options.description: Enable or disable service at boot

content.name: tail
content.description: Display last lines of a file.

content.name: tar
content.description: Archive files into tarballs.

content.name: tcpdump
content.description: Capture network packets.

content.name: tee
content.description: Read from stdin and write to stdout and files.

options.description: Append to file instead of overwrite

content.name: telnet
content.description: Connect to remote hosts using Telnet protocol.

content.name: touch
content.description: Create empty files or update timestamps.

options.description: Do not create if not exists

content.name: traceroute
content.description: Trace route packets take to a host.

content.name: umount
content.description: Unmount a filesystem.

content.name: uname
content.description: Display system information.

example.output: Displays kernel name, version, and architecture

content.name: uniq
content.description: Filter duplicate lines in a file.

content.name: uptime
content.description: Show system uptime and load averages.

content.name: useradd
content.description: Add a new user.

content.name: userdel
content.description: Delete a user.

content.name: usermod
content.description: Modify user account properties.

example.output: Creates VG vg0 with two physical volumes

content.name: vgdisplay

content.description: Text editor in terminal.

content.name: w

content.description: Send a message to all logged-in users.

content.name: wc

example.output: Prints line, word, and character count

content.description: Locate a command executable in PATH.

content.description: Repair XFS filesystems.

content.name: yum
content.description: Package manager for Red Hat-based systems.

content.name: zip
content.description: Compress files into a zip archive.

example.output: Creates archive.zip containing file1 and file2

content.description: View compressed files without uncompressing.
